project.teaser: The fifth generation of wireless technology (5G) has arrived and is being rolled out globally. First industrial sectors such as manufacturing are testing the capabilities of 5G showing great potential for ubiquitous connectivity. With the sixth generation (6G), wireless...
project.objective: The fifth generation of wireless technology (5G) has arrived and is being rolled out globally. First industrial sectors such as manufacturing are testing the capabilities of 5G showing great potential for ubiquitous connectivity. With the sixth generation (6G), wireless communication will bring new features, improved performance, and functional benefits to several industrial sectors. The TARGET-X project envisions accelerating the digital transformation of key verticals: energy, construction, automotive, and manufacturing using large-scale trials in multiple testbeds. By demonstrating, validating, and evaluating the potential of 5G/6G in real environments, the most advanced 5G/6G technologies such as real-time communication, localization, self-description, digital twinning, and sensor-network data fusion can be tested and evaluated. The focus of the evaluation is on KPIs and especially KVIs, such as sustainability, safety, security, and privacy. Based on these KVIs, new business models and a methodological assessment framework for economic and societal evaluation will be developed. The development of the solutions will be supported and guided by the TARGET-X community, a network of SMEs, IT- and OT-partners, and up to 100 FSTP third parties, bringing together a strong consortium with SMEs and innovation drivers. To reach TARGET-X's goals, a selection of use cases will be established for all verticals in the existing 5G testbeds. New 5G/6G features will be developed and integrated into the testbeds and validated in evolved use cases. The FTSP projects will both deliver new use cases and technical contributions. A large number of FTPS participants will strengthen the 5G/6G ecosystem. Results of the project will be discussed with 6G-SNS projects and used for standardization, also in the different verticals.
project.title: Trial PlAtform foR 5G EvoluTion – Cross-Industry On Large Scale
project.keywords: trial sites, manufacturing, energy, automotive, construction, 5G, 6G, digital transformation, real-time, mmWave, localization, self description, digital twinning, economical and societal evaluation

result.title: Report on system design options and 5G/6G setup for edge robotics
result.description: D2.2 provides a requirements analysis regarding thedifferent applications demands for the interface devices created in Task2.2 and the definition of potential use cases.The contents of the deliverable will be further used in Task2.2 and Task2.3.

result.title: Forward looking use cases, their requirements and KPIs/KVIs
result.description: The public deliverable will contain a detailed description of the use cases, their requirements and the defined andemployed KPIs and KVIs. Additionally, the results achieved through the KPI/KVI-based assessment will be in-cluded. Furthermore the evaluation methodology will be published enabling the KPI/KVI-based assessment of dif-ferent use cases. This deliverable also represents the first milestone of TARGET-X.

result.title: Roadmap for the 5G/6G empowered deconstruction robotic platform

result.title: Design and implementation of required sub- models, exposures and interface
result.description: This deliverable will focus on defining the AAS requirements, submodels for the verticals, as well as designing/im-plementing required exposures and interfaces that will be leveraged to populate the AAS submodels.

result.title: 1st Call Announcement and Guide for Applicants

result.title: 2nd Call Announcement and Guide for Applicants
result.description: Report containing the information and the requirements for the applicants to the 2nd open call.

result.title: Integrated pilot setup
result.description: This deliverable describes the detailed testbed setup, including the 5G network,the edge computing facilities and a description of the use case scenarios and requirements. A set of KPIs will bedefined for the automotive use cases. D4.1 will also document the system integrations performed necessary to beable to deploy and validate the use cases.

This includes the requirements analysis and possible solutions to enable the tradeoffrequired to ensure flexibility and good performance of the prototypes.

category.title: 5G
category.displayCode: /engineering and technology/electrical engineering, electronic engineering, information engineering/information engineering/telecommunications/telecommunications networks/mobile network/5G

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
